repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Second Phase of the
            Community Based Rural Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Phase of the
            Community Based Rural Development (CBRD) Project for Burkina
            Faso were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was low, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: effective harmonization of
            approaches around government policies is critical. The
            sustained success of the CBRD program as a whole reflects
            its efforts to support the government's evolving vision
            on decentralization. Achieving effective decentralization
            requires sustained and holistic support to champions within
            government and in civil society. Capacity building is more
            effective when it focuses on sustainable institutions and
            occurs through learning by doing. Involvement of the whole
            community, especially the poor and marginalized, is
            essential to ensure that ownership and commitment to local
            development efforts are maintained. Communication and
            collaboration are critical for ensuring community ownership
            of project activities and social cohesion. Monitoring and
            Evaluation (M and E) information flows can become
            overwhelming as a project's scale increases, its
            activities evolve, and new lessons continually emerge. A
            programmatic approach, with adequate flexibility to
            incorporate innovations and sufficient technical assistance
            for piloting and testing at each stage, is a key success
            factor for building the confidence of staff and communities,
            helping to fine-tune the model, and enhancing the prospects
            for achieving development outcomes.

0.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Programme National de
            Gestion des Terroirs

repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Second Community Based Rural
            Development Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Second Community
            Based Rural Development Project for Burkina Faso is to
            support the Recipient's rural communes in planning and
            implementing local development activities in a participatory
            and sustainable manner. The Project contributes to the
            second phase of the National Program for Decentralized Rural
            Development. The extension is necessary to due to the
            reasons highlighted below: (a) as a results of this
            year's food crisis, the project supports 170 rural
            communes with the provision of food and grain subsidies to
            poor and vulnerable households; in partnership with the
            National Coordination of the Project, SONAGES, Mayors and
            their Councils, and this activity is currently in full swing
            and will continue for the remaining of the year 2012 and
            beyond; (b) with respect to the complexity of procurement
            procedures at the level of rural communes, and on the basis
            of the experience of the last three years, completion of
            planned investment for 2012 will not become effective before
            the end of the first quarter of 2013; and (c) with municipal
            and legislative elections scheduled for December 2012, this
            is impacting key local development actors - mayors,
            municipal councilors and members of Village Development
            Councils - as this may delay implementation of communal
            investments and activities.

Burkina Faso - Second Community
            Based Rural Development Project : restructuring  (Vol. 2) :
            Data sheet
